subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Keto and Paleo Movements
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Keto and Paleo Movements usable.

hook.text: First fat was evil. Then carbs were. The pendulum of diet trends swings hard and never stops.

buildup.text: Paleo said eat like a caveman â€” meat, vegetables, no grains. Keto said eat almost no carbs at all.

discovery.text: Both diets work for weight loss â€” by reducing total calorie intake. Neither has a unique metabolic advantage.

twist.text: Actual paleolithic diets varied enormously by region. The 'caveman diet' is a modern invention, not historical.

climax.text: Every successful diet shares one feature: it helps you eat fewer calories than you burn. The label is irrelevant.

punchline.text: Diet trends change every decade. The calorie equation never does.

quiz.question: What do all successful weight-loss diets have in common?
options: They help you eat fewer calories than you burn
